com.wpruszak.blitzch.lib.interfaces

Interface FileSaver

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FileSaverImpl

    public interface FileSaver
    The main file saving interface for IOController to provide an easy interchangeable way of saving files.

    FileSaver provides:

    • Saving String at the end of the File without erasing prrevious file content
    • Saving String to the File and erasing all of the previous file content
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    setzo
    See Also:
    IOController, FileLoader, FileSaverImpl

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void saveStringToFileAppend(File file, String newContent)
      Save given String into given File appending it to the end of the file.
      void saveStringToFileOverwrite(File file, String newContent)
      Save given String into given File overwritting the file and leaving the string as the only file content.

    • Method Detail

      • saveStringToFileAppend

        void saveStringToFileAppend(File file,
                            String newContent)
                     throws IOException
        Save given String into given File appending it to the end of the file.

        This method will not erase the previous file contents. It will add given string at the end of the file.

        Parameters:
        file - to append given string to
        newContent - string to append to given file
        Throws:
        IOException - if is I/O corrupted

      • saveStringToFileOverwrite

        void saveStringToFileOverwrite(File file,
                               String newContent)
                        throws IOException
        Save given String into given File overwritting the file and leaving the string as the only file content.

        This method will erase the previous file contents.

        Parameters:
        file - to overwrite with given string
        newContent - string to be overwritten as a new file
        Throws:
        IOException - if I/O is corrupted
